docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Saying that Leona Helmsley had been motivated by ''naked greed,'' a Federal judge in Manhattan sentenced her yesterday to a four-year prison term and fined her $7.1 million for tax fraud. Mrs. Helmsley, who described herself in advertisements as the queen of the Helmsley hotel chain, would be eligible for parole after 16 months in prison.

headline.main: Helmsley Gets 4-Year Term For Tax Fraud
